events.name: First Puppet User Group Meetup - Singapore - October 15th
events.description:
Join us for our first Puppet User Group Meetup in Singapore, October 15th at 6:00pm.  Puppet user groups are community-organized meetups, where people can discuss topics of interest related to Puppet.   Enjoy some light refreshements while hearing technical talks from local Puppet Users and Puppet Labs Engineers. These meetups are a great way to share ideas and network within the local tech community.   Speaker: Rob Finn - Director APAC Puppet Labs Topic:  How Automation Will Help YouScale to Meet the Demands of the Next Decade 


Speaker: Dyland Radcliffe - PS Engineer - Puppet Labs Topic: Puppet Overview + Testing 


If you would like to speak or sponsor, please contact me at [masked] Joe
events.location: Suntec City NUSS - The College Room, 3 Temasek Boulevard (Tower 5) #02- 401/402 Suntec City Mall Singapore 038983

events.name: Intro to User Experience
events.description: Today, we interact with technology more than ever before and our access to digital products and services designed to make our lives easier continues to rapidly increase. Users ultimately want digital experiences that minimize frustration and provide seamless interactions, so how can we more effectively anticipate and tackle the problems users might have online?  The answer: Good user experience design.  Join Experience Lead at Huge, Julie Kondo, for an Intro to UX that will define what user experience design is, how it impacts your daily life, and how good UX design can completely transform experiences for the better. Julie will also cover valuable tips like how to get started in UX and how to build a good UX portfolio. About the Speaker: Julie Kondo, Experience Lead at Huge As a UX designer, Julie Kondo’s job is to help brands build digital products their customers will love. Specializing in service design, Julie has worked with large-scale international companies including Google, Toyota and Disney build experiences that reach millions of customers daily. Over the past three years, Julie has worked at digital agency Huge, where she’s done stints in their New York, Los Angeles and Singapore offices. She is currently based in Singapore, where she leads the UX on one of the agency’s largest accounts and helps grow Huge’s UX talent in the region. Prior to joining Huge, Julie was a Product Developer at Nickelodeon, where she focused on designing mobile apps and building prototypes.
events.location: Huge Singapore, 33 Ann Siang Rd, Suite 31A

events.name: React Workshop (Basic)
events.description: Build a ToDo list with React (or build something else if you are more adventurous). We'll be using https://github.com/shioju/react-todo for the workshop. The latest commit is a working example. Clone the repo and checkout the clean commit to try building it yourself. Volunteers needed to help guide the beginners. Reply to the comment if you wanna help. Thanks. Bring your laptop. Hands-on is compulsory. ;-p -=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=- Wanna share at one of our meetups or request a topic? Just contact any of us below: • Sheng Hau (chaishenghau@gmail.com) • Wendy (sohwendy@gmail.com) • Raphael (raphaeltanyw@gmail.com) • Yun Long (chong.yunlong@gmail.com)
events.location: Hive@Sandcrawler, 1 Fusionopolis View #08-01, Singapore

events.name: DevOpsDays Singapore
events.description: https://ti.to/devopsdays-singapore/2015/ Join us for 2-days DevOpsDays and connect with DevOps professionals from all over the world and share your experiences, ideas, and tools relating to DevOps and Agile. Checkout the program: http://www.devopsdays.org/events/2015-singapore/program/ About DevOpsDays DevOpsDays is a 2-days conference that brings development and operations together. We have exciting keynote sessions, talks and open spaces to combine all the benefits of a traditional conference with the benefits of unconference. Why Attend? Whether you're in government, academia, or the private sector, DevOpsDays is for you. Whether you're in operations, development, QA, security, or any other department, DevOpsDays is for you. Whether you want to learn about DevOps, share your experiences, or just talk shop with DevOps practitioners, DevOpsDays is for you. DevOpsDays are a mix of keynote sessions and open spaces. The keynotes and open spaces will include discussions on topics such as: Register As a member of the DevOps Meetup Group you can use the discount code 'DEVOPS_MEETUP' (without quotes) while getting your ticket to enjoy a discount on your tickets! Register here: https://ti.to/devopsdays-singapore/2015/ See you soon! (RSVP is not required and it does not count as registration)
events.location: Raffles City Convention Centre, 80 Bras Basah Rd Singapore 189560

events.name: TGIFHacks #40 - Interactive Web-app w Angular JS
events.description:
In this workshop, we will learn how to build an interactive web-apps using state-of-the-art JavaScript framework Angular JS. Besides writing the code, you could also expect to know more about popular front end architectures and design patterns.

Requirements
•	Basic knowledge of HTML. (If you have participated in our prev workshop on HTML this is for you! if not, just visit http://tinyurl.com/tgifhacks37 and read the introduction!

Preparation
•	Understand the role of JavaScript and backend programs in PHP or Python or etc. Link: http://blog.teamtreehouse.com/i-dont-speak-your-language-frontend-vs-backend
•	Learn basic JavaScript syntaxes. Link: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Guide
•	Charge your laptop and bring it to the workshop!
events.location: The Nest Theatre @ Innovation Centre

events.name: Friday Hacks #100: Engaging with the tech community beyond school, Lightning talks, and free beer!
events.description:
NUS Hackers is celebrating our 100th Friday Hacks!

To mark this occasion, we have a very special talk from Sayanee about engaging with the tech community beyond school. We'll also be holding Lightning talks (5mins each) with speakers from NUS, NTU, SUTD and all over Singapore!

If you're interested to give a lightning talk, contact vishnu@nushackers.org.

We'll update this event description with confirmed lightning talks on Friday.

After-Event Bash

There's going to be a after-event bash with free food and beer.

Description: 

How can a student engage with the technology industry beyond school? This talk will scan through practical tips for getting started online and getting involved with projects. What communities can you join easily and learn? Which meetups can you attend and even help to co-organize? How to start contributing to open source? Can we easily share with by writing our own blogs, books or even making podcasts? What are some interesting social media accounts or blogs to follow? How can we add in short trips to engage with locals while traveling anywhere in the world? We will discuss all these questions and more!

Speaker profile:

Sayanee Basu is a full stack developer working with emerging web technologies at Ricoh Pte. Ltd. in Singapore. Her key interest lies in connecting the web and the internet to the physical world through sensors and hence, much of her free time is now spent in tinkering with electronics and computer networks. She creates Build Podcast, a screencast series on developer tools as well as actively contributes to the Singapore tech community through curation of events, open source projects at webuild.sg and a developer focused podcast with We Build LIVE. She graduated from National University of Singapore in Electrical Engineering.

You can find out more about her at http://sayan.ee!
events.location: SR3, Town Plaza, University Town, National University of Singapore

Also, please sign up at  http://letsjoin.in/barcampsg as - if we are successful at getting food sponsorship - catering will be sized by number of sign-ups.

1: What, you don't think "unconfer" is a suitable verb to describe what happens at an unconference? https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unconference

events.name: Signals of Tomorrow Innovation Lab
events.description:
Signals of Tomorrow Innovation Lab
17-18 Oct, Sat to Sun, 10am to 6pm
ArtScience Museum, Level 4
FREE

As part of Sunday Showcase, The Signals of Tomorrow Innovation Lab presents imaginative ways to engage the public in envisioning the future of technology and a Smart Nation. An invited group of participants across art, design and technology will work together to imagine what the future for a Smart Nation could entail. Involving narrative scenarios, critical thinking, participatory art and rapid prototyping, this showcase will aim to produce unique, creative perspectives on the developing landscape evolving around new technology. 

FutureEverything Singapore is a partnership between FutureEverything and Singapore's Infocomm Development Authority (IDA), one of the key government agencies championing Singapore’s efforts to become the world’s first Smart Nation. IDA is the organiser of the umbrella programme, the Festival of Tech (www.festivaloftech.sg).
events.location: ArtScience Museum

events.name: FutureEverything Conference: Signals of Tomorrow
events.description:
FutureEverything Conference: Signals of Tomorrow
Saturday 17 October
10.15am -7.00pm
ArtScience Museum, Level 4
FREE

What is a smart nation, and what does it mean to be a smart citizen? How are artists, designers, futurists and civic innovators playing with the technology that is weaving itself into the fabric of our cities, economies and infrastructure? In partnership with ArtScience Museum, FutureEverything’s first ground-breaking conference in Singapore will look at how life, work and play have been fundamentally transformed by technology, and will form part of a national conversation in Singapore on the place of smart technology in society and culture. Noted speakers include critical futurist Scott Smith, designer and Internet of Things expert Alexandra Deschamps-Sonsino, technology critic and fellow of Harvard’s Berkman Institute Sara Watson, lead strategist for globalfutures agenda Cheryl Chung, Nanyang Technical Institutes’ Andrea Nanetti, and the team behind Hello Lamppost, PAN Studios.

FutureEverything Singapore is a partnership between FutureEverything and Singapore's Infocomm Development Authority (IDA), one of the key government agencies championing Singapore’s efforts to become the world’s first Smart Nation. IDA is the organiser of the umbrella programme, the Festival of Tech (www.festivaloftech.sg).

Due to the strong interest in the Conference: Signals of Tomorrow, registration will be required and admission will be on a first-come, first-serve basis. 

Registration is on the day itself at the following times:
-	Morning sessions: 9.30am
-	Afternoon sessions: 2pm

More details about the schedule and sessions can be found at http://futureeverything.org/festival/singapore/conference-3/calendar/
events.location: ArtScience Museum

events.name: Introduction to React.js - hackerschool
events.description:
Everyone's talking about React.js -- but what exactly is it? React.js is a User Interface JavaScript library from Facebook/Instagram, and it completely changes the way front end engineering is done. We'll learn why it's special and how to get started with it in the first React.js hackerschool.
This workshop is open to the public. It's held on Oct 17th, Saturday, 1:00pm. to 4:00pm, at SR3, Town Plaza, University Town, National University of Singapore.

Participants should know HTML, CSS, JavaScript.

Note: Laptop required

http://school.nushackers.org
events.location: SR3, Town Plaza, University Town, National University of Singapore

events.name: October FPV Meetup: Learning to race, basic race course, rules & etiquette
events.description: Location: "Marina East" Closest MRT: Stadium The park is in the corner between Tanjong Rhu View and Rhu Cross, just north of the ECP flyover.  There are a few trees and a bit of open space, very good for proximity flying and racing practice.  It's about a 15 minute walk from Stadium MRT if you are travelling by public transport, and there is a carpark nearby if you're coming by car.  If you have difficulty finding us then contact me by whatsapp/sms: +6591001743  We'll set up a fairly simple race course (or a combined simple / complex course if there are more advanced pilots) talk through the 'rules' and then get going with some trial laps. As always, the following rules apply:1) Don't switch on your VTx without pre-announcing it to fliers currently in the air and waiting for their confirmation2) Make sure you know your VTx frequency and are able to adjust it3) During racing, if you're not currently racing do not switch on at all, until the current race is complete4) Don't fly beyond your own abilities We're a friendly and encouraging group though, so even if you're a beginner we'll help you to get started. NB - This is a casual meetup and all attendees are responsible for their own safety and liability.
events.location: Rhu Cross, Rhu Cross, Singapore

events.name: Front End TL;DR
events.description: Have you ever come across something new in front end, had the browser tab open for weeks, but never found time to research it? Use this event as an excuse to dig a little deeper. Front End TL;DR is a learning event where everyone participates. Helps to bring a laptop. Join to level-up your front-end knowledge, meet other front-end developers, or learn how the engineers at BitTitan ship code. 7:00pm — Arrival, seating, food & drinks7:15pm — Intro talk by the host7:30pm — R&D: random team assignment, choose a topic, learn something new9:00pm — Q&A: share what your team learned9:30pm — The end. There will be guest wifi, food & drinks provided. Every third Monday of the month. Different venue each time. More info: http://feds.strikingly.com/
events.location: BitTitan, 1 Fusionopolis Way, #05-10 Connexis North Tower, Singapore 138632

events.name: HTML5, VorlonJS and ASP.NET 5 MVC 6
events.description: Hi all, We will be having a meetup next week. We will talk about HTML5 with ASP.NET 5. But will focus on the HTML5 itself. And let's do debugging with VorlonJS. HTML5 is very important topics, although ASP.NET 5 (by default) Razor is using HTML5, but some developers are tend to use HTML 4.x in that sense they just set the render mode to HTML5. So, we will share what is HTML5 and how to create forms properly in HTML5 and using the CSS, etc. And how to make the web renders okay with non modern browsers. The key is, don't detect the browsers, instead detect the features of the browsers. Please join this meetup so we can learn and share ASP.NET 5 using HTML5. Calling for speakers! All topics in ASP.NET 5 (Server side and Client Side). We got VorlonJS T-Shirts for those who wants to share VorlonJS topics. Regards,Riza
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: DevOps Mindset & Kanban Workshop
events.description: DevOps Mindset what is DevOps mindset and is it important one of the definition is "DevOps is the organizational mindset that enables continuous delivery - a focus on everybody working together to improve development performance measures such as throughput while at the same time increasing stability and reducing mean time to restore service Kanban in Action  The getKanban Board Game is a physical board game designed to teach the concepts and mechanics of Kanban for software development in a  workshop setting. It has been described as the most effective way to teach Kanban. It’s hands-on, engaging, and fun. During the workshop the teams construct charts based on data from the game including a Cumulative Flow Diagram, and a Statistical Process Control Chart. Speakers  Maris has 17 years of IT consulting experience as Servant Leader, providing fiscal, strategic &operational leadership in uniquely challenging situations . He orchestrate as Agile Change Agent primarily in the role of Agile Coach and Enterprise agile Transformer. Maris has had extensive experience in architecting agile process solutions using the flavors of Scrum, XP, Kanban and Lean operational waste reduction and implemented in various types of projects. He holds Engineering Degree in Electrical and Post graduate in Software systems from BITS and Senior Management from IIM Calcutta. He holds CSM, CSP, PMI-ACP, SAFePC[masked]), PMP, PRINCE 2, ITIL, PMOC, TOGAF9, DAD-YB, and SCEA. Sandeep is an Enterprise transformation specialist, Agile Leader and Extreme Programming Coach with his decade of contributions in Agile development spread across Investment Banking, Healthcare, Enterprise Resource Planning, product development, Program & Portfolio management tailoring wide range of Agile Frameworks. He holds PMP, PMI-ACP, DAD WB & YB, CSM, CSP, CSPO and a couple of MCTS certifications from Microsoft.

events.name: Node.JS, Spring Cloud and microservices
events.description:
Talk 1: Is Node.js the future of Java/Spring? Thibault Weintraub has already presented for us back in December last year. We had interviewed him here. In addition to be a great Java programmer, he is also a secret fan of Node.JS.Thibault will take us a side by side comparison between Java/Spring and Node.JS. As you will see, not everything should be done with Node.JS. But there are some situations in which it is much easier to use than Java. 


Talk 2: migrating a monolith app to microservices Carlos Queiroz has done lots of work on microservices and Spring Cloud in the past few months. He will be starting from a monolith Spring app and will show you how it can be migrated step by step to a series of lightweight micro-services using Spring Cloud for the communication between services.
events.location: PayPal office in Suntec, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985 Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore

events.name: iOS Ladies Workshop #1: Swift for Beginners
events.description: Swift is the elegant, simple, easy and powerful new language that Apple introduced last year. It can be used to create applications for iPhone, iPad, Mac desktops/laptops, and the Apple Watch.  In this introductory session for women, you will learn about the tools to build an iPhone app, the basics of the Swift programming language and get to build your 1st iOS app. You will also hear some lightning talks from local and international iOS developers who will be speaking at the first iOS Conference in Singapore. To get the most out of this workshop, you must have a Mac with Xcode 7 installed. You can download and install Xcode for FREE. https://developer.apple.com/xcode/. Make sure to install it prior to the session as the file is pretty big.  If you don't have a Mac then you can pair with someone at the event. Agenda06:30PM: Registration and Dinner (Pizza is provided!)07:00PM: Introduction to Xcode and Storyboard07:45PM: Hands-on Excercises. Familiarize yourself with the Tools and Components.08:15PM: Lightning Talk #108:20PM: Let’s learn about Swift 2.0!09:05PM: Lightning Talk #209:10PM: Time to build some apps! You will try your hands on building your personal PSI haze app.09:55PM: Quick revision + Next steps FAQsWhat should I bring?A Mac laptop and power supply. How do I check what version of Xcode I currently have?Checking your current version of Xcode is easy! Simply open Xcode, click on ‘Xcode’ on the top bar and select ‘About Xcode’. You should see a pop out that will tell you what version of Xcode you have. Is this free?Yes, absolutely free! We are committed to introduce more women to programming. Can I come if I'm not a woman?iOS Ladies is designed for women and anyone who self-identifies as a woman. Men are most welcomed as a participant's +1 . Is there an age limit?Nope! Event is full! What should I do?Join the waitlist! We'll let you know when a new slot becomes available. Also, please update your RVSP if your plans have changed. Someone will really appreciate your slot. :) I'm a professional iOS Developer, can I be a coach?Yes, we are always looking for iOS experts to help! Please contact Elisha at [masked] and DO NOT RSVP to this event. Confirmed coaches:- --
events.location: Paypal at Suntec , 5 Temasek Blvd, #07-01 Suntec Tower Five, Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore

events.name: Business 365 Saturday | Singapore
events.description: October 24, 2015 This is the event to attend in 2015 for in-depth insights from world leading experts in the areas of SharePoint, Skype for Business, Office 365 and Office. Whether you are looking for technical knowledge, architectural approaches, or business strategy, this is where you will find your answers. We expect to have 15 topic sessions covering all aspects of SharePoint, Skype for Business, Office 365, and Office 2016. This Business 365 Saturday is a unique event because it is absolutely free, anyone can attend, it won't interfere with your work schedule, and it's planned with a community focus in mind. We bring the experts, consultants, and Microsoft MVPs from around the country to share their experiences, tips, and best practices. You won't get a day of sales pitches, instead you will receive training and the opportunity to network with other users. This is a great opportunity for you to meet other Microsoft professionals in the Singapore community, ask questions, network, and share your experiences. We expect a variety of educational sessions for: • End Users • Power Users • SharePoint, Skype for Business, Office 365 Administrators • Developers • Project Managers • Architects • IT Strategists & Executives For detail agenda please visit our website http://business365.azurewebsites.net
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: Rails Girls Meetup (October)
events.description: Following up from our previous session in September, we have planned another fun-filled Ruby on Rails workshop for you all this month! As usual, we will have a structured workshop syllabus to facilitate learning for the beginners. For those who have been attending our meetups regularly and/or know the basics of Ruby on Rails, our flexibility will still be there. If you'd like to work on your project or run through concepts/material with guidance, our coaches are more than happy to help and answer your questions. We love the enthusiasts! Come and join us at the October Rails Girls meetup! Agenda: • 10:00 - 10:15 Registration • 10:15 - 10:20 Introduction • 10:20 - 10:30 Break into groups • 10:30 - 13:00 Start to code  ---------- FAQs ---------- I haven't attended any previous Rails Girls events. Can I still join in this one? Absolutely! We can help you start with the Rails Girls app if you did not attend the last workshop. What should I bring? A working laptop and power supply. Is this free? Yes! But we are not providing any food/coffee. Can I come if I'm not a woman? Rails Girls is designed for women and anyone who self-identifies as a woman. Men are most welcomed as a participant's +1 . Is there an age limit? Nope! Event is full! What should I do? Join the waitlist! We'll let you know when a new slot becomes available. Also, please update your RVSP if your plans have changed. Someone will really appreciate your slot. :) I'm a professional Rails Developer, can I be a coach? Yes, we are always looking for Ruby/Rails experts to help! Please contact Nathania (nathaniawong89@gmail.com) and DO NOT RSVP to this event. Confirmed coaches: - Sherwyn - Ted - Lachlan Can my company sponsor Rails Girls meetup? Thank you for helping us build an awesome community! If your company would like to sponsor this meetup, please get in touch with Winston (winston.yongwei@gmail.com).
events.location: SkyScanner Ltd, 39 Robinson Road #09-01 Robinson Point, Singapore

events.name: Papers We Love #014
events.description:
Paper #1: mov is Turing-complete : Yeo Kheng Meng http://www.cl.cam.ac.uk/~sd601/papers/mov.pdf

Paper #2: A Framework for Automated Generation of Questions Based on First-Order Logic : Shubham Goyal 

-------------------

What was the last paper within the realm of computing/technology you read and loved?

What did it inspire you to build or tinker with? 

Come share the ideas in an awesome academic/research paper with fellow engineers, programmers, and paper-readers. 

Lead a session and show off code that you wrote that implements these ideas or just give us the lowdown about the paper (because of HARD MATH!). Otherwise, just come, listen, and discuss.

-----------------

Original Meetup : http://www.meetup.com/papers-we-love
Papers Repo : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love
Code of Conduct : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.A Framework for Automated Generation of Questions Based on First-Order Logic

events.name: Virtual Reality TL;DR with OSVR Demo
events.description:
For this meetup, we expect guests from OSVR (Open Source Virtual Reality) with their high end Hacker Kit. You can be one of the first in Singapore, who will try it. Have you ever come across something new in VR but you don't have the HMD for it? Or you want to create something for VR but you can't find someone to work together with? Use this event to collaborate and find out more about VR websites, videos, games and apps. We will break the participants in groups and you guys decide what you guys want to do. VR TL;DR is a learning event where everyone participates. Helps to bring a laptop for the event. Please install the VR games, apps or sdk that you are interested to share or work on before the event. After that, each group will share what they learned, tried or build. You guys can bring your VR input/output too. Please let us know. We will put it on the list. Expected VR input output. Oculus Rift DK2 x 1 Real Sense x 1 Kinect windows x 1 Structure io 3d scanner x 1 cardboard x 4 Agenda 7.15 pm - OSVR intro - Marquis, Dev Relations from Razer, OSVR 7.30 pm - R&D: random team assignment, choose a topic, learn something new 9.30 pm - Q&A: share what your team learned 





In Partnership with

events.name: Hackware v1.2
events.description:
Hackware is a monthly meetup for hardware developers and enthusiasts to share hacks and developments in the hardware scene, promote hardware development and to build a community of hardware developers. 

Our talks typically include side projects by speakers on electronics, embedded system, radio communications, internet of things, radio frequency and much more! Come and just drop by for all our open and free meetups, make friends with fellow enthusiasts or beginners and feel free to sign up for a talk slot on whatever you are working on.

Agenda & Talks for this meetup:

1. (10min) Homemade HEPA Air Filter - Xong Sing Yap

2. (20min) FPGA: The basics - Brahim Hamadicharef
Prelude to the FPGA.SG v0.1 Meeting / Workshop October 2015

3. (5min) IoT hardware with Meteor Javascript - Rick Behl

4. Announcements by anyone on:
- Hiring positions
- Available for hire
- Other upcoming hardware-related events locally or anywhere else

5. Socialize and Network with other Hackware members

Talks : ~20mins
Lightning Talks : ~5mins
Announcements: ~1min

Sponsors:

events.name: Bluemix SG Meetup #5: Watson
events.description:
Hey Bluemixers, On the #5 meetup of IBM Bluemix, we have invited 2 winning team of the Singapore App Challenge competition to show the products they have developed. Come to our meetup to find the cognitive computing power of Watson how it's being applied in the airline travel industry.  Stay tuned for more updates. 


IBM Bluemix Technical Envangelist team.
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951

events.description: This is our regular monthly meeting, join us to learn more about Amateur Radio and our activities!

events.name: FPGA.SG v0.1 Meeting / Workshop October 2015
events.description: This will our first FPGA.SG Meeting / Workshop. Plan is to introduce FPGA topic, programming tool and language, development board, and spend the afternoon going through some tutorials and demos, and lot of discussions.
events.location: HackerspaceSG

events.name: Sense and Sensuality: The Art & Aesthetics of Wearable Technology
events.description:
Sense and Sensuality: The Art & Aesthetics of Wearable Technology
31 Oct- 1 November, Sat to Sun, 10am to 7pm
ArtScience Museum, Level 4
FREE

Sense and Sensuality celebrates new creative approaches that bring artists and designers together with engineers, scientists, and scholars from other fields. This showcase examines how technology is being used to interact with our body, cultures and surroundings, and engage our senses and expand our sensibility. Artists participating in this exhibition comprise faculty, students and alumni from ADM. The showcase is divided into five areas including craft, form, function, expression, and dimension in relation to technology.
Official fringe event of Digital Fashion Week Singapore 2015
events.location: ArtScience Museum

events.name: Bike building workshop
events.description: Do you remember the wacky and fun upcycled bikes at Maker Faire Singapore? Well, Mo and his team from Bikes4Fun will be joining us to facilitate a parent - child bicycle building workshop
events.location: Science Centre Singapore

events.name: Fabric Hacking with Adafruit Flora
events.description: A collaboration with volunteers from Microsoft, as part of the Code for Change programme, Fabric Hacking with Adafruit Flora explores how you can light up your T Shirt or hat. Lets get together for a Halloween themed fun fiesta. Stay tuned for details
events.location: Science Centre Singapore

events.name: Dream Brewery Hackathon
events.description: The love for beer and its craft has been around for ages but nothing has changed much since. Here’s a crazy idea for you. What would happen if we apply technology to this classic drink? Come hack 3 challenges with ABInBev at the Dream Brewery Hackathon on November 7th & 8th and stand a chance to win cash prizes, cool toys & even mentorship support to revolutionise the F&B space!  Use “Free4iOSDev” @ http://Bitly.com/dreambreweryhackathon­ to get FREE tickets to the hack!  PRIZES • The first place team will receive S$2,000 and Apple iWatches  Second Place Team: S$1,000 + Cherokey 4wd Robot Kits • Third Place Team: S$500 + Insectbot Kits • Immediate Qualification: The top 3 winning teams directly qualify for the Budweiser Dream Brewery Pitch Day on February 18, 2016 (pitch your tech and your team could win: S$25,000 funding, incubation & partnership opportunities)  JUDGES  • APAC CIO, ABInBev • APAC Innovation Manager, ABInBev • Tyson Hackwood, Head of Asia, Braintree • Bradley Priest, CTO/Cofounder, TradeGecko • Michael Lints, Venture Partner, Golden Gate Ventures • As well as other top CTOs and VCs
events.location: The Hub Singapore, 128 Prinsep Street, #01-01

events.name: Learn Chef Configuration Management Part 1
events.description: ** Had to bump this due to logistics and availability **The future of management and configuration of the Microsoft platform is Desired State Configuration. Chef is a configuration management product that is fully leveraging the DSC platform is important to the DevOps movement. There is some great content at learnchef.io which I have wanted to go through for a while but have yet to schedule in. So I am scheduling the time to do it.If you would like to Learn Chef too, join me for this Meetup. I cannot provide any expertise on Chef whatsoever, but I can provide a room with a big screen, food, uninterrupted time to watch the content and go through the labs as well as others to discuss with and expertise on DSC.If this sounds like something you'd like to do please come along, let's learn Chef and progress our journey to DevOps.
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room

events.name: Azure and SGDotNET User Group Meeting @ 13th Nov 2015 7:00pm
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room

events.name: Hackware v1.3
events.description:
Hackware is a monthly meetup for hardware developers and enthusiasts to share hacks and developments in the hardware scene, promote hardware development and to build a community of hardware developers. 

Our talks typically include side projects by speakers on electronics, embedded system, radio communications, internet of things, radio frequency and much more! Come and just drop by for all our open and free meetups, make friends with fellow enthusiasts or beginners and feel free to sign up for a talk slot on whatever you are working on.

Agenda & Talks for this meetup:

1. (20min) Astro-photography and hardware (Celestial Portraits)- Remus CJ

2. (20min) TBC

3. (20min) TBC

4. Announcements by anyone on:
- Hiring positions
- Available for hire
- Other upcoming hardware-related events locally or anywhere else

5. Socialize and Network with other Hackware members

Talks : ~20mins
Lightning Talks : ~5mins
Announcements: ~1min

Sponsors:

♥ Venue provided by Science Center Singapore ♥ http://www.science.edu.sg/Pages/SCBHome.aspx
events.location: Digital Planetarium Singapore

events.name: Maker Immersion Camp 2015
events.description:
Here is a chance for students aged 10-14 to collaborate for Maker Camp 2015. 

Learn: Woodworking, microcontrollers, Programming, Electronics, Fabric Hacking, Design thinking. 

Soft skills: Testing, tinkering, project design, teamwork, collaboration
events.location: Science Centre Singapore
